issue.title: `reshape_input`, `reshape_output`

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
A proposed fix for #870 

(EDIT: also fixes #895 )

includes a working demo in `Scattering1D` module
the same idea could work in other dimensions with the same methods `reshape_input` and `reshape_output` (no need to specialize them per 1D/2D/3D scattering!)

to help reviewers, i haven't moved the code from specialized frontends to the base frontend, only created call sites for `reshape_input` and `reshape_output` in 1D. But that's the idea of course. (could be done in a separate PR after review and resolution of merge conflicts)

body:
Sounds like an oversight from when we introduced `out_type = "dict"` back in the day. I would be in favor of removing, but it's hard to do this in a way that's backwards-compatible yet not too ugly (basically it would involve creating a new `out_type = "new_dict"` or something like that). We have three alternatives:

(1) Do nothing.
(2) Break the old behavior by removing the singleton dimension.
(3) Add a new `out_type = "legacy_dict"` that has the extra dimension and redefine `out_type = "dict"` to do the right thing.

Honestly I don't think this is a central enough feature that (2) is a problem, but am open to discuss.

> Sounds like an oversight from when we introduced out_type = "dict" back in the day. 

Yes. In fact, we didn't introduce out_type='dict' explicitly but under the form of the `out_type='array'` + `vectorize=False` combination. So it's not entirely surprising we didn't think this keyword combination through.

> Honestly I don't think this is a central enough feature that (2) is a problem, but am open to discuss.

Me too, i can have it either way. I just wanted to pin down this issue so as to explain why my #871 PR has this weird statement:

```python
n_kept_dims = 1 + (self.out_type == "dict")
```

Making `n_kept_dims = 1` systematically would simplify the `reshape_output` logic a great deal. But i can also live without it.
So I think we're in agreement here. Let's just go with (2) and make a not in the changelog.

ok good. phew, that's good news for me: keeping score of this effect was starting to get annoying.

i don't think anyone will notice. this case is non default (setting vectorize=False yet leaving out_type='array' and not changing it to 'list'). and the fix in user code is very simple anyway

issue.title: FIX include 'n' field in 1D/2D list + remove singleton dimension in 1D dict

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
Fix #875, Fix #895
as discussed in today's Kymatio meeting

NB: these changes must be in the release notes.

issue.title: Automatic self.meta() and self.output_size()

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
Continuation of the Scattering1D simplification/decoupling streak: #871, #877, #879, #880.

The `DryBackend()` is now in full swing:

```python
        class DryBackend:
            __getattr__ = lambda self, attr: (lambda *args: None)

        S = scattering1d(None, DryBackend(), self.psi1_f, self.psi2_f,
            self.phi_f, self.oversampling, self.max_order)
        S = sorted(list(S), key=lambda path: (len(path['n']), path['n']))
```

No more calling the `scattering_filter_factory` to get self.meta() !
And no more mimicry of depth-first search in a `utils.py` function. We're now relying on core scattering to perform the depth-first search.

This remains backwards compatible so could be merged for v0.3. The role of this PR was to offer a proof of feasability towards automatic meta in JTFS

I have moved the legacy implementation (`compute_meta_scattering`) to the test suite so that we can verify backwards compatibility
